snippet: Texas, which had the highest posted speed limit in the country six years ago, will once again earn that distinction as state officials voted to raise the limit to 85 m.p.h. along a stretch of highway.
abstract: Posted speed limit on State Highway 130 between Austin and San Antonio, Texas, will be raised to 85 miles per hour when the road opens in November, making it the highest in the nation; the only other state with a posted speed limit that rivals Texas is Utah, with 80 mph zones on parts of I-15.
lead_paragraph: Texas, which had the highest posted speed limit in the country six years ago, will once again earn that distinction as state officials voted to raise the limit to 85 m.p.h. along a stretch of highway.

headline.seo: Texas Raising Speed Limit for Title of Fastest in the Land
headline.main: Reclaiming the Title of Fastest in the Land
headline.print_headline: Reclaiming The Title Of Fastest In the Land
